references.paper_title: Weisfeiler and lehman go cellular: CW networks
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel graph neural network architecture that generalizes convolutional layers, demonstrating improved expressivity for graph classification tasks.

references.paper_title: Weisfeiler and lehman go topological: Message passing simplicial networks
references.reason: This paper proposes a topological approach to graph neural networks, enhancing their capability to capture complex graph structures and improving classification performance.

references.paper_title: Improving graph neural network expressivity via subgraph isomorphism counting
references.reason: This paper presents a method for enhancing graph neural network expressivity by incorporating subgraph isomorphism counting, which leads to improved accuracy in classifying complex graphs.

references.paper_title: Inductive representation learning on large graphs
references.reason: This paper introduces a significant approach to inductive representation learning on large graphs which is a fundamental technique used in many graph neural network architectures.

references.paper_title: How powerful are graph neural networks?
references.reason: This paper provides a theoretical analysis of the expressive power of graph neural networks, establishing a benchmark for the capabilities and limitations of these models.
